description: From Ancient Greek χάρισμα (khárisma, “grace, favour, gift”) + -ic.

adjectives.description: charismatic (comparative more charismatic, superlative most charismatic)

entries.meaning: Of, related to, or having charisma.
Of, related to, or being a member of a form of Christianity that emphasizes the role of the Holy Spirit.
A member of the Charismatic Movement.
examples: At a time when mainline denominations are engaged in massive closures of small rural churches, independent charismatics are strategically helping to rechurch rural Canada.
